file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-23-08-04 - RUDDER STOP MICROSWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RUDDER STOP MICROSWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: JAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT (POST-MOD SB 145-27-0015 OR FACTORY- MODIFIED) 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the stop microswitches of the stop actuators of the rudder control system. B. These procedures are applicable to the two stop microswitches. C. The stop microswitches are installed in the compartment behind the rear pressure bulkhead. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY JAA-CERTIFIED AIR- CRAFT (POST-MOD SB 27-23-08-000-801-A STOP MICROSWITCH - REMOVAL 145-27-0015 OR FAC- TORY-MODIFIED) JAA-CERTIFIED AIR- CRAFT (POST-MOD SB 27-23-08-400-801-A STOP MICROSWITCH - INSTALLATION 145-27-0015 OR FAC- TORY-MODIFIED) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-23-08 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-23-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: JAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT (POST-MOD SB 145-27-0015 OR FACTORY- MODIFIED) 2. STOP MICROSWITCH - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the stop microswitch of the stop actuator of the rudder control system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-42-00/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Compartment behind the rear pressure 311 312AR bulkhead D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Compartment behind the rear pressure 1 Does the task bulkhead I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 and ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. (3) Open access door 312AR (AMM MPP 06-42-00/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-23-08 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Cut the lockwire (1). (2) Disconnect the electrical connector (3). (3) Remove the nut (5) to release the stop microswitch (2) from the stop actuator (4). (4) Remove the stop microswitch (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-23-08 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: JAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT (POST-MOD SB 145-27-0015) Stop Microswitch - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 311 B B DET. A 2. STOP MICROSWITCH 3. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR JAM NUT ( REF. ) 1. LOCKWIRE 4. STOP ACTUATOR 2. STOP MICROSWITCH 5. NUT 1. LOCKWIRE 3. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR DET. B ( TYP. ) - 0 C 1 11.1 + 0.3 4. STOP STOP ( REF. ) ACTUATOR DET. C 5. NUT 1 DIMENSIONS IN MILLIMETERS 145AMM270352.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-23-08 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-23-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: JAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT (POST-MOD SB 145-27-0015 OR FACTORY- MODIFIED) 3. STOP MICROSWITCH - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the stop microswitch of the stop actuator of the rudder control system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-42-00/100 - RUDDER MOVABLE PRIMARY STOP MECHANISM - AMM TASK 27-21-00-700-801-A/500 OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Compartment behind the rear pressure 311 312AR bulkhead D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) As nec- MS20995C32 Lockwire essary G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Compartment behind the rear pressure 1 Does the task bulkhead I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the stop microswitch (2) on the stop actuator (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-23-08 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Adjust the distance between the end of the stop microswitch (2) and the stop at the stop actuator (4). For this, adjust the jam nut at the stop microswitch (2). Refer to DET. C. (3) Tighten the nut (5) to attach the stop microswitch (2) to the stop actuator (4). (4) Connect the electrical connector (3). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 and ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. (2) Do an operational check of the Rudder Movable Stop Mechanism System ( AMM TASK 27-21-00-700-801-A/500). (3) Safety the stop microswitch with the lockwire (1) shown in Figure 401. (4) Close access door 312AR (AMM MPP 06-42-00/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-23-08 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
